SENT.plain: BACKGROUND: Weakness and fatigue are accepted as normal accompaniments of aging
Usually, older individuals are not investigated with much enthusiasm but a treatable cause is discernible on several occasions

CASE PRESENTATION: We had a 67 year old hypertensive lady with a mitral stenosis, presenting in ischemic or hypertensive heart failure with underlying valvular disease, without pulmonary hypertension in sinus rhythm
She had pancytopenia with severe anemia and raised liver enzymes
Bone marrow examination showed aplastic anemia
She was treated with ATG and improved subsequently to become transfusion free
However, she succumbed to an unrelated sudden cardiac death
CONCLUSION: Our patient is unique in her uncommon presentation, complex management issues and a favorable outcome after a long and persevering therapeutic intervention and finally her sudden death
